intro: Remijia leiocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing, succulent perennial that thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the cooler months. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water and reduce transpiration. Remijia leiocalyx is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
